instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
board came with missing, cd3215. replaced it and i get 20v 144ma on charger. CPU heats up but no CPU vcore
resistance on vcore is 8ohm (phase 1 &2). CPU dead?

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
8 ohm is not short.
If board was messed up before by someone else, could be a nightmare.
A simple knocked off component can cause the problem.
A1534 boards are known for CPU problems, could be wasting time...

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
unfortunately for me customer is paying alot for data, i will have to even replace CPU if needed.
i dug alittle further, found that vcore power was not enabled by u7100.
and possible for you to help check if R7861 is supposed to be no stuff or i'm indeed missing a resister there

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message: R7861 is needed as pull-up resistor for power good signal from CPU core rail.

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message: yeap. boards ben sabotage, replaced R7861 and now board now boots up but with question mark folder

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
SSD failure is classic for these boards too.
Check if other component has been intentionally removed.

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
no other component that i can find that are missing related to SSD.
when you say Classic SSD failure, the NAND itself fail?
i see alot videos with same symptoms but they do a CPU reball instead and SSD is back.

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
Could be caused by CPU, or SSD controller.
People on Internet claim they reballed both...

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
sorry for ranting but WTF??? board came from a customer who previously passed to a shop who says can't be fix and needed board replacement.
she needed data but sabotaging the board for business? i'll make sure this shop is properly backlisted and known to all local shops and customers to stay away. they pulled 2 resisters  R9376 for Nand control and R7861 for Vcore enable. 

thx much for the assistance

threads.title: 820-00687 not booting
threads.message:
You are a lucky man.
Go and buy lottery ticket...
